Data Structures | Macros | Enumerations
System Devices
Peripheral Input/Output
Collaboration diagram for System Devices:

Detailed Description

This driver provides details about the currently installed operating system.

Data Structures

Macros

#define SYS_DEVICE
 This defines the configuration values for the system device (/dev/sys) device in the device table.
 
#define NULL_DEVICE
 This defines the configuration values for the null device (/dev/null) device in the device table.
 
#define ZERO_DEVICE
 This defines the configuration values for the null device (/dev/null) device in the device table.
 
#define FULL_DEVICE
 This defines the configuration values for the full device (/dev/full) device in the device table.

Macro Definition Documentation

#define I_LED_SET

This sets the state of the specified LED.

Example:

#include <unistd.h>
#include <dev/sys.h>
...
led_req_t req;
req.channel = 0;
req.on = 1;
ioctl(led_fd, I_LED_SET, &req); //turns LED on channel 1 on
#define I_SYS_GETATTR

This request applies the software write protect to the entire device.

Example:

#include <dev/sys.h>
#include <uinstd.h>
#include <stdio.h>
...
sys_attr_t attr;
ioctl(fildes, I_SYS_GETATTR, &attr);
printf("Version is %s\n", attr.version);
#define I_SYS_GETPROCESS

This requests checks to see if the named process is currently running.

sys_process_t p;
strcpy(p.name, "hello");
ioctl(fd, I_SYS_ISRUNNING, &p);
if( p.pid < 0 ){
//process is not running
}
#define I_SYS_GETTASK

This request gets the information about the specified task.

sys_task_t task;
task.tid = 1;
ioctl(fd, I_SYS_GETTASK, &task);
#define I_SYS_KILL

This request sends a signal to all the tasks in the specified process group.

#define I_SYS_LOCK

This request locks the device. When locked, certain operations are disabled based on the value of security in sys_attr_t;

ioctl(fd, I_SYS_LOCK);
#define I_SYS_PTHREADKILL

This request sends a signal to a single task (thread)

#define I_SYS_UNLOCK

This request unlocks the device. When unlocked, all operations are available (the security word has no effect).

sys_lock_t lock;
strcpy(lock.key, "the passord");
ioctl(fd, I_SYS_UNLOCK, &lock);
if( lock.status == 0 ){
//device is still locked
}
#define LED_DEVICE (   dev_name,
  active_level,
  pio_port0,
  pio_pin0,
  pio_port1,
  pio_pin1,
  pio_port2,
  pio_pin2,
  pio_port3,
  pio_pin3 
)

This defines the configuration values for an LED device that can drive up to 4 LEDs.

Parameters
dev_nameThe name of the led device
active_levelLED_ACTIVE_LOW or LED_ACTIVE_HIGH
pio_port0The port for channel 0
pio_pin0The pin for channel 0
pio_port1The port for channel 1 (use LED_DEVICE_UNUSED if not used)
pio_pin1The pin for channel 1 (use LED_DEVICE_UNUSED if not used)
pio_port2The port for channel 2 (use LED_DEVICE_UNUSED if not used)
pio_pin2The pin for channel 2 (use LED_DEVICE_UNUSED if not used)
pio_port3The port for channel 3 (use LED_DEVICE_UNUSED if not used)
pio_pin3The pin for channel 3 (use LED_DEVICE_UNUSED if not used)

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum sys_security_flags_t
Enumerator
SYS_SECURITY_RESET 

Allows desktop interface to reset the device

SYS_SECURITY_INVOKEBOOTLOADER 

Allows desktop interface to invoke the bootloader (can always be invoked manually)

SYS_SECURITY_READFLASH 

Allows desktop interface to read the flash memory (where OS and application binaries are stored)

SYS_SECURITY_APPINSTALL 

Allows desktop interface to install custom applications (warning: custom applications can get around security)
